text: Ethel Llewellyn Ennis (November 28, 1932 - February 17, 2019) was an American jazz singer. She was born in Baltimore, Maryland. She was known as the "First Lady of Jazz". == Career == Her debut was with 1955's Lullabies for Losers was released by Jubilee Records. In 1957, Ennis moved to the Capitol Records label for a two-album contract, and A Change of Scenery was released. Ennis toured with Benny Goodman and Duke Ellington during her career. She performed the main song for the movie Mad Monster Party?. Ennis was invited to sing at the second inauguration of Richard Nixon. == Death == Ennis died at her home in Baltimore from a stroke on February 17, 2019, aged 86. ==References== ==Other websites== *Ethel Ennis' Biography at Allaboutjazz.com *Ethel Ennis's oral history video excerpts at The National Visionary Leadership Project *New York Times review of 1994 album Category:1932 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:American jazz singers Category:Singers from Baltimore
title: Ethel Ennis
